column4: no you are not, theres a way to mount your wubi partition, i think is something like when you mount an iso drive, google it
im not sure how to fix your actual wubi, depending on the error
I get to where I can pick the os, if I pick UNR it restarts the machine. If I pick XP it boots normally
i dont know wubi but i once read about how to recover data from wubi partitions, have to mount your windows partitions and then mount -o loop your wubi disk,  but i recommend google it
